“Next to a circus there ain’t nothing that packs up and tears out faster than the Christmas spirit.” – Frank McKinney Hubbard

“A Christmas shopper’s complaint is one of long-standing.” – Author Unknown

“Merry Christmas, nearly everybody!” -Ogden Nash

“If you can’t wrap Christmas presents well, at least make it look like they put up a good fight.” – Author Unknown

“What I don’t like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day.” -Phyllis Diller

“People are so worried about what they eat between Christmas and the New Year, but they really should be worried about what they eat between the New Year and Christmas.” – Author Unknown

“Anyone who believes that men are the equal of women has never seen a man trying to wrap a Christmas present.” – Author Unknown

“Christmas shopping. Never an easy or a pleasant task.” -Harry in Love Actually

author: Katharine Whitehorn, Roundabout

quote: One can never have enough socks. Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn’t get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.
author: Professor Dumbledore in Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone

quote: I hate Christmas. The mall is full of nothing but women and children. All you hear is, ‘I want this,’ ‘Get me this,’ ‘I have to have this’… and then there’s the children. And they’re all by my store ’cause they stuck the mall Santa right outside ringing his stupid bell. As if you need a bell to notice a 300-pound alcoholic in a red suit. ‘Ho, ho, ho,’ all day long. So, nice as can be, I go outside, ask him to shut the hell up. He takes a swing at me. So I lay a hook into his fat belly and he goes down. Beard comes off, all the kids start crying and I’m the bad guy.
author: Al Bundy in Married With Children

quote: Christmas shopping. Never an easy or a pleasant task.
author: Harry in Love Actually

quote: If you see a sign that says ‘Peep Show’, that doesn’t mean they’re letting you look at presents before Christmas.
author: Father Christmas in Elf

quote: Damn. How can you give Kris Kringle a parking ticket on Christmas Eve? What’s next, rabies shots for the Easter Bunny?
author: Santa Claus in Home Alone
